This is not going to be a commercial success, for the same reasons it hadn't been for the past 50 years albeit being a pretty mature technology. It's too small to beat the economy of scale of huge cargo ships, its speed and range are not even close to modern jet airliners, plus it can't actually fly like an aircraft, so it can't reach anywhere inland. Its true potential is probably limited to replacing small boats, but I'm guessing owners of small boat can't really afford a fancy ground effect vehicle that costs millions of dollars.
